definition: to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
to sprinkle/to spray/to spill/to shed

sentences.english: Google's natural impulse is to unleash its algorithms on this video content in order to search it.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌的本能是在影片內容上揮灑其演算法以利搜尋。

sentences.english: Dryad : Flyer, No Enemy Retaliation, Spray Attack, Treant Union.
sentences.chinese: 飛行兵種，無反擊，揮灑攻擊，樹精聯盟。

sentences.english: This is so that the viewer can fill in the rest with his or her imagination.
sentences.chinese: 這是爲了讓觀衆可以在空白處盡情揮灑想象力。

sentences.english: You’re truly a social butterfly and love to scatter your energy everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 你的確是個社交花蝴蝶，喜歡到處揮灑自己的活力。

sentences.english: The BBC Symphony Orchestra played with great panache .
sentences.chinese: 英國廣播公司交響樂團演奏起來揮灑自如。

sentences.english: I bent, held some water, threw to a distance.
sentences.chinese: 我彎下身，掬起一捧海水，向遠方揮灑。

sentences.english: How they dance in the parterre sweet summer sweat.
sentences.chinese: 在花壇中他們舞的多歡，揮灑着夏日甜味的香汗。

sentences.english: Literally meaning two hander's, in German, in reference to the grip needed to wield their massive swords.
sentences.chinese: 雙手巨劍需要緊密掌握方可揮灑如意。

sentences.english: He swims easily in the stream of his own temperament.
sentences.chinese: 他將自己的氣質秉性揮灑自如，如行雲流水。

sentences.english: The hot sun, we sprinkle with sweat, has no doubts whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 炎炎烈日下，我們揮灑着汗水，卻無怨無悔。

sentences.english: Taiping Street fabulously displays Changsha's thousand-year-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 一條太平街，將長沙千年來的文化盡情揮灑。

sentences.english: Enforcement of such scholars take hold a brush, stippling sway, they dress.
sentences.chinese: 文人執之如搦毛筆，點畫揮灑，氣定神閒。

sentences.english: He lifted the brush pen, and wrote three words smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 他舉起筆來揮灑自如的寫了三個字。

sentences.english: Sprinkle in good conversation and witty repartee and you are on to something special.
sentences.chinese: 在談吐中靈敏機智，揮灑自如讓你做到特別。

definition: to be quick-witted
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
to gallop/to rush headlong
pen and ink/words/writing
painting brush

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
comfortable/enjoyable/relaxed
to suggest (rather than depict in detail)/freehand style of Chinese painting, characterized by bold strokes rather than accurate details
opportunity to live/to reprieve from death/life force/vitality
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
to enchant/fascinating
tension
gorgeous/magnificent
vivid/lively
